question:
For debugging purposes, you need to record how many times a given JSP is invoked before the
user’s session has been created. The JSP’s destroy method stores this information to a database.
Which JSP code snippet keeps track of this count for the lifetime of the JSP page?

options.A: <%! int count = 0; %> <% if ( request.getSession(false) == null ) count++; %>
options.B: <%@ int count = 0; %> <% if ( request.getSession(false) == null ) count++; %>
options.C: <% int count = 0; if ( request.getSession(false) == null ) count++; %>
options.D: <%@ int count = 0; if ( request.getSession(false) == null ) count++; %>
options.E: <%! int count = 0; if ( request.getSession(false) == null ) count++; %>
